Main Code Documentation

Post-Optimization Analysis Script

This module performs a post-optimization analysis that includes:

  • Running a multi-objective optimization via multiobjective_optimization().

  • Merging feedstock usage data with constraints.

  • Creating a feedstock-availability bar chart.

  • Generating chord and Sankey diagrams for flow visualization.

author:

tghosh

date:

Wed Mar 12 20:42:23 2025

main_run.create_chord_diagram(eq_df: DataFrame, feed_df: DataFrame, yr: int, output_folder: str)[source]

Build and display a chord diagram illustrating the flow from feedstock to chemicals.

Parameters:

  • eq_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame that must include the columns ['Feedstock', 'Chemical', 'Feedstock_flow'].

  • feed_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame used to determine main feedstocks.

  • yr (int) -- The target year, used only for naming or in the figure title if desired.

  • output_folder (str) -- Path to the folder where the output files will be saved.

main_run.create_sankey_feedstocks(eq_df: DataFrame, html_filename: str, output_folder: str)[source]

Generate a Sankey diagram showing multi-use feedstocks flowing to chemicals, excluding flows that are 100% dedicated to one chemical.

Parameters:

  • eq_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame that must contain columns: ['Feedstock_flow', 'Chemical', 'Feedstock', 'Long name'] for flow details.

  • html_filename (str) -- File path (including folder) to save the resulting Sankey diagram as an HTML file.

  • output_folder (str) -- Path to the folder where CSV outputs will be saved.

main_run.create_sankey_pathways(eq_df: DataFrame, html_filename: str, output_folder: str)[source]

Generate a Sankey diagram showing multi-use pathways flowing to chemicals, excluding flows that are 100% dedicated to one chemical.

Parameters:

  • eq_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame that must contain columns: ['product_flow', 'Chemical', 'Long name'] for flow details.

  • html_filename (str) -- File path (including folder) to save the resulting Sankey diagram as an HTML file.

  • output_folder (str) -- Path to the folder where CSV outputs will be saved.

main_run.main()[source]

Main function tying the whole workflow together.

The workflow includes:

  1. Parsing user inputs.

  2. Running the optimization.

  3. Analyzing feedstock usage by merging with availability.

  4. Plotting the feedstock usage bar chart.

  5. Creating the chord diagram.

  6. Generating Sankey diagrams for feedstock and pathway flows.

main_run.merge_feedstock_availability(feed_df: DataFrame, yr: int) → tuple[DataFrame, DataFrame][source]

Merge the feedstock usage with its availability for the given year, compute the remaining availability, and sort the results in descending order of usage.

Parameters:

  • feed_df (pd.DataFrame) -- Feedstock usage dataframe from the optimization.

  • yr (int) -- The year used for selecting the correct availability column.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - feed_df_merged (pd.DataFrame): The merged dataframe with additional columns:

['Availability {yr} (MMT)'] and 'Difference'.

  • feedstock_avail (pd.DataFrame): The feedstock availability dataframe.

Return type:

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame]

main_run.parse_user_inputs() → tuple[int, bool, str, bool][source]

Define or parse user inputs for year, TRL filter, metric, and fix_2030_results toggle.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - yr (int): Year to analyze (e.g., 2030 or 2050). - trl (bool): True if 'High TRL' data should be used. - metric (str): The name of the metric to optimize (e.g., 'ghg_emissions'). - fix_2030_results (bool): Whether to fix certain flows/variables to a 2030 reference solution.

Return type:

tuple[int, bool, str, bool]

main_run.plot_feedstock_bars(feed_df: DataFrame, yr: int, output_folder: str)[source]

Create a stacked horizontal bar chart of feedstock usage versus availability.

Parameters:

  • feed_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame with columns ['Feedstock_flow', f'Availability {yr} (MMT)', 'Feedstock'].

  • yr (int) -- The target year (for labeling).

  • output_folder (str) -- Path to the folder where the output files will be saved.

main_run.run_optimization(yr: int, trl: bool, fix_2030_results: bool, metric: str)[source]

Run the multiobjective_optimization function and return the resulting DataFrames.

Parameters:

  • yr (int) -- The target year for constraints (e.g., 2030 or 2050).

  • trl (bool) -- Whether to filter for high TRL only.

  • fix_2030_results (bool) -- Whether to constrain flows based on 2030 data.

  • metric (str) -- The metric to optimize.

Returns:

A tuple containing: - eq_df (pd.DataFrame): Detailed optimization results at equation-level. - feed_df (pd.DataFrame): Aggregated feedstock usage data. - prod_df (pd.DataFrame): Aggregated product flow data (including co-products).

Return type:

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame]
